description: {"blocks":[{"key":"hfdo","text":"This protocol describes the process of labelling and whole mount staining proliferative cells in in vitro juvenile Fasciola hepatica with the thymidine analogue 5-ethynyl-2′-deoxyuridine (EdU). The protocol is based on the Schistosoma mansoni EdU staining protocol developed by the Collins and Newmark groups. A full copy of that protocol is available here - http://collinslab.org/PDF/Whole_mount_EdU_Smansoni.pdf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":115,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":223,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":359,"length":54}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2C87A412FE511EE924B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://collinslab.org/PDF/Whole_mount_EdU_Smansoni.pdf"}}}}

funders.funder_name: LIVER FLUKE MOTOR FUNCTION AND PARASITE CONTROL: EXPLOITING A 'TARGET VALIDATION TOOLBOX' AS A DRUG SCREEN-INTERFACE FOR FLUKICIDE DISCOVERY
Probing in vivo parasite biology in vitro
Exploiting stem cell biology for liver fluke control

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2c8f6","text":"Fixation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4r7m5","text":"While flat fixing is necessary for worms grown for more than three weeks in vitro younger worms may be suitable for free fixing in 4%FA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":73,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Following 1 h heating turn off heat and add NaOH dropwise until solution goes clear before adding   2X PBS.  and mix. Store at   for 2 weeks or  in aliquots for 6 months.

steps.section: In vitro addition of EdU to juvenile F. hepatica
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ae9in","text":"Juvenile liver fluke are cultured in 50% Chicken serum (CS50) as described in McCusker et al. (2016).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35nt9","text":"  of   5-Ethynyl-2'-deoxyuridine (EdU) is mixed with   pre-warmed CS50 and added to worms for between 6 and 24 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"87922BF02FAF11EE89A4F19D7F81F6DB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"8E172D902FAF11EE89A4F19D7F81F6DB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"190","error":false,"guid":"B5A251002FAF11EE89A4F19D7F81F6DB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"bh9h0","text":"EdU Mutagen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47mgk","text":"As a thymidine analogue EdU is known for germ cell mutagenicity and reproductive toxicity.
